availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.collection: 37th - 76th Regiments Enrolled Militia Primary Source Documents (1861-1866)
msIdentifier.idno: Box 80, Folder 861 HANCOCK COUNTY 50th REGT, KY Enrolled Militia Cpt Isaac Lyon's Company Cpt Phillip T. Daniel's Co. Cpt James R. Jennings' Co.

body.p: I hereby certify that a Company of Men styling themselves the Hancock County Home Guards. personally appeared before me, and each one whose name is herein enclosed did take the oath prescribed by the late act of the Legislature for the organization of Home guards. And after which they proceeded to the election of officers when James R Jennings was elected Captain. Chas. C. Hawley 1st Leut W. C. Davidson 2nd Leut and Chas B Duncan 3rd Leut

June 1st 1861
Wm Mason Presiding
Judge of the Hancock County Court
Hancock Co Home Gds -- Cpt. J. R. Jennings -- June 1861
J. R. Jennings Capt. Chas C Hawley 1st Leu. N. C. Davidson 2nd Leut. C. B. Duncan 3d Leut.
